Package it.polimi.ingsw.server

Class VirtualClient

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.VirtualClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.util.EventListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
ApolloTest.VirtualClientStub, AthenaTest.VirtualClientStub, AtlasTest.VirtualClientStub, GodSelectionControllerTest.VirtualClientStub, MinotaurTest.VirtualClientStub, WorkerTest.VirtualClientStub
public class VirtualClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.beans.PropertyChangeListener
Virtual client interface; this is a representation of the virtual instance of the client, which is connected through server socket. It's used for preparing an answer for sending and for general operations on the client too.
Version:
1.1.0
Author:
Luca Pirovano

    void send​(Answer serverAnswer)
    Prepares the answer for sending it through the network, putting it in a serialized package, called SerializedMessage, then sends the packaged answer to the transmission protocol, located in the socket-client handler.

  • Method Details

    • getClientID

      public int getClientID()
      Returns:
      the unique ID of the client, which identifies him and his connection in the server system.

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected()
      Returns:
      true if the connection with the client is active yet.

    • getGameHandler

      public GameHandler getGameHandler()
      Returns:
      the game manager of his match.

    • getNickname

      public java.lang.String getNickname()
      Returns:
      the nickname of the player in String format.

    • getConnection

      public SocketClientConnection getConnection()

    • send

      public void send​(Answer serverAnswer)
      Prepares the answer for sending it through the network, putting it in a serialized package, called SerializedMessage, then sends the packaged answer to the transmission protocol, located in the socket-client handler.
      Parameters:
      serverAnswer - the answer to be sent to the user.
      See Also:
      for more details.

    • win

      public void win​(Answer win)

    • sendAll

      public void sendAll​(Answer serverAnswer)
      Send the message to all playing clients, thanks to the GameHandler sendAll method.
      Parameters:
      serverAnswer - the message to be sent.

      propertyChange in interface java.beans.PropertyChangeListener
